When your opponent activates a monster effect (Quick Effect): You can add 1 "Twirlstia" monster from your Deck to your hand. If you control this card that was Fusion Summoned using only "Twirlstia" monsters as Fusion Material: You can target 1 monster on the field or in the GY; return it to the hand, but for the rest of this turn, you cannot Normal Summon/Set, Special Summon, nor activate the effects of monsters with that name. You can only use each effect of "Twirlstia Swanrouge" once per turn.
side.name: Twirlstia Swanrouge

side.effect:
1 non-Link "Twirlstia" monster
If a "Twirlstia" monster(s) is Special Summoned to your field: You can Fusion Summon 1 Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck, by using "Twirlstia" monsters from your hand or field as Fusion Material, including this card. You can only Special Summon "Twirlstia Owlarctic(s)" once per turn.
side.name: Twirlstia Owlarctic

main.effect: Add 1 "Ventuoso" monster from your Deck to your hand, then you can make the ATK/DEF of 1 monster on the field become the added monster's ATK/DEF. You can only activate 1 "Ventuoso Blessing" per turn. While this card is in your GY, all "Ventuoso" monsters you control gain 100 ATK/DEF.
main.name: Ventuoso Blessing

main.effect: This card can be used to Ritual Summon any "Vendread" Ritual Monster from your hand or GY. You must also Tribute monsters you control OR return Zombie monsters in your banishment to your GY whose total Levels equal or exceed the Level of the Ritual Monster you Ritual Summon. If a "Vendread" card(s) would be banished while you control "Revendread Slayer" or a monster that mentions it, you can banish this card from your GY instead. You can only use each effect of "Vendread Remembrance" once per turn.
main.name: Vendread Remembrance

main.effect: You can Ritual Summon this card with any "Vendread" card. (Quick Effect) You can banish this card from your hand, field or GY, then target 1 Ritual Spell in your GY or banishment; apply its effect. If "Revendread Slayer" or a monster that mentions it is Special Summoned: You can Special Summon this banished card. (This is treated as a Ritual Summon.) You can only use each effect of "Vendread Coalescence" once per turn.
main.name: Vendread Coalescence

main.effect:
Tomayto, Tomahto, Potayto, Potahto.
Tomahto, Potayto, Potahto, Tomayto,
And 'That Never Could' one think it should,
All things persist as all things can't could,
There, in That Evær'Wood.
- That Evær'Wood Vol. I
main.name: Vegetables of That Evær'Wood
main.pendulum_effect: When a monster(s) "That Evær'Wood" you control are destroyed, you can place any number of them in your Spell & Trap Zone(s) as Continuous Traps, instead of placing them in the face-up Extra Deck. Pendulum Monsters placed this way gain their Pendulum Effects. You can target 1 face-up card your opponent controls; Set it, then if this card is a Continuous Trap, Tribute it. You can only use this effect of "Vegetables of That Evær'Wood" once per turn.

main.effect: Unless you control a "Veda" Pendulum Monster or "Visas Starfrost", this card loses 400 DEF. If this card was Summoned this turn, or if the Pendulum Scale of a card in your Pendulum Zone is increased by a card effect, while this card is in your hand: You can Special Summon 1 "Veda" monster from your Deck or GY, then destroy this card. You can only use this effect of "Veda Kala" once per turn.
main.name: Veda Kala

main.effect: You can send this card from your hand or field to the GY; add 1 "Eldlixir" Spell/Trap from your Deck to your hand. If this card is Summoned, and you control "Eldlich the Golden Lord": You can target 1 card on the field; send it to the GY. You can only use each effect of "Vassal of Eldlich" once per turn.
main.name: Vassal of Eldlich

main.effect:
During the Main Phase (Quick Effect): You can target 1 non-Dragon "Vanquish Soul" monster you control; return it to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon this card from your hand. (Quick Effect): You can activate 1 of these effects, by revealing monster(s) in your hand with the listed Attribute(s);
● EARTH: This face-up card is unaffected by your opponent's activated effects this turn.
● EARTH, FIRE, & DARK: Destroy 1 other card on the field.
You can only use each effect of "Vanquish Soul Caesar Valius" once per turn, and cannot activate more than 1 in the same Chain.
main.name: Vanquish Soul Caesar Valius

main.effect: You can reveal this card and 1 Zombie monster in your hand; Special Summon 1 of them and discard the other. When a monster is destroyed by battle involving your "Vampire" monster and sent to the GY, while this card is in your GY: You can pay 2000 LP; add this card to your hand, and if you do, Special Summon that destroyed monster to your field. You can only use each effect of "Vampire Vlad" once per turn.
main.name: Vampire Vlad

main.effect: When your opponent activates a card or effect (Quick Effect): You can pay 1000 LP; that activated effect becomes "Both players send the top card of their Deck to the GY". You cannot Special Summon monsters from the Extra Deck the turn you activate this effect, except DARK "Vampire" monsters. If you control a 'Vampire" monster while this card is in your hand or GY: You can banish 1 other "Vampire" card from your GY and discard 1 card; Special Summon this card, but banish it when it leaves the field. You can only use each effect of "Vampire Headhunter" once per turn.
main.name: Vampire Headhunter

main.effect: If you control a face-up "Vampire" card: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. You can banish 1 "Vampire" card from your GY; Set 1 "Vampire" Spell/Trap from your Deck or GY to your Spell & Trap Zone, but banish it when it leaves the field. You can only use each effect of "Vampire Due" once per turn.
main.name: Vampire Due

main.effect:
Once per Chain, if a card(s) is sent from your opponent’s Deck to their GY by a card effect, while you control a “Vampire” monster: You can target 1 card on the field; send it to the GY. You cannot activate this effect of “Vampire Coronation“ again this turn, when a card(s) with that same original type (Monster/Spell/Trap) is sent to the GY. If this face-up card on the field is destroyed by your opponent’s card effect: You can activate 1 of these effects.
● Until the End Phase of the next turn, you can Normal Summon Level 5 or higher “Vampire” monsters without Tributing.
● Add 1 “Vampire” Spell/Trap from your Deck to your hand, except “Vampire Coronation”
main.name: Vampire Coronation

main.effect: During your Main Phase: You can Special Summon 1 WIND Warrior monster from your hand, but its effects are negated, and if you do, return that Summoned monster to your hand. If a WIND Warrior monster(s) is added to your hand, except by drawing it: You can discard 1 of those added monsters; draw 1 card. You can only use each effect of "Valley of the Five Winds" once per turn.
main.name: Valley of the Five Winds

main.effect: If you control no Effect Monsters: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. If you control a face-up non-Effect Monster: You can banish this card from your hand or GY; Special Summon 1 "Tenyi" monster that is banished or in your GY, except "Unknown Tenyi Spirit", also, you cannot Special Summon monsters for the rest of this turn, except Wyrm monsters. You can only use each effect of "Unknown Tenyi Spirit" once per turn.
main.name: Unknown Tenyi Spirit

main.effect: Target 1 "Carcharrack" monster in your GY; Special Summon it. During the End Phase: You can Set this card from your GY to your field, but banish it when it leaves the field. You can only use 1 "Undersea Rescue of the Carcharracks" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Undersea Rescue of the Carcharracks

main.effect: Target 1 face-up monster your opponent controls; your opponent can send 1 monster with the same Type and Attribute but a different name from their Deck to the GY to negate this effect, otherwise banish that target, and if you do, if that target was a Fish monster, you can add 1 Field Spell from your Deck to your hand. You can only activate 1 "Uncharted Shipwreck" per turn.
main.name: Uncharted Shipwreck

main.effect: If "Stultifera Navis, the Ship of Fools" is in the Field Zone, you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). You can only Special Summon "Ulpianus, Shadow of Stultifera Navis" once per turn this way. If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can discard 1 card, then target 1 card on the field; destroy it, then, if it was a WATER monster, monsters "of Stultifera Navis" you control will gain 500 ATK until the End Phase. You can only use this effect of "Ulpianus, Shadow of Stultifera Navis" once per turn. This card can attack all WATER monsters your opponent controls once each.
main.name: Ulpianus, Shadow of Stultifera Navis

main.effect: You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by sending 2 cards from your hand to the GY. You cannot Summon monsters from the Extra Deck. When this card is Special Summoned from your hand: You can target 1 card on the field; send it to the GY. Once per turn, if a monster(s) is Special Summoned from the Deck or GY: You can banish 1 of those card(s) face-down. You can only control 1 "Ukupanipo, the Carcharrack of the South Seas".
main.name: Ukupanipo, the Carcharrack of the South Seas
main.treated_as: Ukupanipo, the Carcharrack of the South Seas

main.effect: While all monsters you control are WATER Fairy monsters, you can activate the effects of "Twirlstia" monsters in your hand as Quick Effects. You can only use each of the following effects of "Twirlstia Wings of Hope" once per turn. You can discard 1 card; add 1 "Twirlstia" card from your Deck to your hand. If your opponent Special Summons a monster(s) while you control a "Twirlstia" monster: You can place 1 card from your hand on the bottom of your Deck, and if you do, draw 1 card.
main.name: Twirlstia Wings of Hope

main.effect: You can discard 1 card; Special Summon this card from your hand, also if you do not control another "Twirlstia" monster, you cannot Special Summon monsters for the rest of this turn, except WATER and Fairy monsters. (Quick Effect): You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; it loses 800 ATK/DEF for every "Twirlstia" monster you control, then if its ATK is 0, you can send it to the GY. You can only use each effect of "Twirlstia Shrikeiris" once per turn.
main.name: Twirlstia Shrikeiris

main.effect: If you control a "Twirlstia" monster, except "Twirlstia Puffinteal": You can send this card from your hand or face-up field to the GY; draw cards equal to the number of "Twirlstia" monsters you control +1, then shuffle cards from your hand into the Deck equal to the number of "Twirlstia" monsters you control. If a "Twirlstia" monster(s) is sent to the GY, while this card is in your GY: You can target 1 of your banished "Twirlstia" monsters, except "Twirlstia Puffinteal"; Special Summon it, and if you do, it gains 900 ATK, also banish this card. You can only use each effect of "Twirlstia Puffinteal" once per turn.
main.name: Twirlstia Puffinteal

main.effect: If you control a "Twirlstia" monster, except "Twirlstia Oriolerose": You can send this card from your hand or face-up field to the GY, then target 1 card your opponent controls; destroy it. You can banish this card from your GY; add 1 "Twirlstia" card from your GY to your hand. You can only use each effect of "Twirlstia Oriolerose" once per turn.
main.name: Twirlstia Oriolerose

main.effect: If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can send 1 "Twirlstia" card from your Deck to your GY, then if "Twirlstia Wings of Hope" is in your Field Zone, until the end of this turn, all "Twirlstia" monsters you control gain 600 ATK/DEF. If you control a Special Summoned "Twirlstia" monster: You can Special Summon 1 "Twirlstia" monster from your GY, but negate its effects. You can only use each effect of "Twirlstia Gullnavy" once per turn.
main.name: Twirlstia Gullnavy

main.effect: If you control a "Twirlstia" monster, except "Twirlstia Falcongold": You can send this card from your hand or face-up field to the GY; Fusion Summon 1 "Twirlstia" Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck using monsters from your hand or field as Fusion Material. During your Main Phase: You can excavate the top 5 cards of your Deck, then you can either send to the GY or Special Summon 1 excavated "Twirlstia" monster, also shuffle the remaining cards into the Deck. You can only use each effect of "Twirlstia Falcongold" once per turn.
main.name: Twirlstia Falcongold

main.effect: If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can add 1 "Twirlstia" monster from your Deck to your hand, then you can Special Summon 1 "Twirlstia" monster with a different name from your hand. You can banish this card from your GY; shuffle up to 3 "Twirlstia" cards that are banished and/or in your GY into your Deck, then if you shuffled 3 cards this way, you can draw 1 card. You can only use each effect of "Twirlstia Doveblush" once per turn.
main.name: Twirlstia Doveblush

main.effect: If this card is in your GY: You can target 1 face-up "Twirlstia" card you control; return it to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon this card, but banish it when it leaves the field. During your Main Phase: You can Fusion Summon 1 "Twirlstia" Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck by using monsters from your hand or field as Fusion Material. If "Twirlstia Wings of Hope" is in your Field Zone, you can also banish monsters from your GY as Fusion Material. You can only use each effect of "Twirlstia Cranesky" once per turn.
main.name: Twirlstia Cranesky

main.effect: If you control a "Rallyence" monster: Take 1 "Rallyence" monster from your Deck with a different name from the monsters you control, and either add it to your hand or equip it to a monster you control. If you control a "Rallyence" card in your Spell & Trap Zone: You can banish this card from your GY, then target 1 "Rallyence" monster in your GY; Special Summon it. You can only use 1 "Turbo Rallyence" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Turbo Rallyence

main.effect:
You can Ritual Summon this card with an "Aethery" card. Must first be either Ritual Summoned, or Normal Summoned. You can only use 1 of the following effects of "Tsufuyu, Sentinel of the Aethery" per turn, and only once that turn.
● If this card is Normal or Ritual Summoned: You can send 1 "Aethery" card from your Deck to your GY, except "Tsufuyu, Sentinel of the Aethery".
● If this card is Tributed by a Normal Trap effect: You can excavate the top 5 cards of your Deck, and if you do, you can add 1 excavated "Aethery" card to your hand, also shuffle the rest into the Deck, then gain 300 LP for each Ritual Monster in your GY.
main.name: Tsufuyu, Sentinel of the Aethery

main.effect:
Activate 1 of the following effects.
● Shuffle cards from your hand into the Deck, up to the turn count; draw cards equal to the number of cards shuffled into the Deck +1, also for the rest of this Duel, you cannot use this effect of "Try Something New".
● Each player with a hand banishes cards from the top of their Deck, face-down, equal to the number of cards in their hand, then shuffles their entire hand into the Deck, then adds those face-down banished cards to their hand.
You cannot draw cards by Spell effects the turn you activate this card, except by the effect of "Try Something New".
main.name: Try Something New

main.effect:
If you control no "Adventurer Token": You can Special Summon this card from your hand or GY to your opponent's field, then Special Summon 1 "Adventurer Token" (Fairy/EARTH/Level 4/ATK 2000/DEF 2000). You can only use this effect of "Troublesome Traveler and Friendly Fiend" once per turn. If your opponent controls a Token, this card gains these effects.
● This card cannot be used as Fusion, Synchro, Xyz or Link Material.
● Your opponent cannot use monsters they control as Fusion, Synchro, Xyz or Link Material.
main.name: Troublesome Traveler and Friendly Fiend

main.effect: If your opponent controls 3 or more monsters than you do, or if your opponent controls 3 or more Spells/Traps than you do: Draw 1 card, then destroy 2 cards your opponent controls, then banish up to 3 cards from your opponent's GY. For the rest of the turn after this card resolves, double all damage you would take from your opponent's cards.
main.name: Triple Threat Takedown

main.effect: Place 1 card from your hand on the bottom of the Deck; add 1 Level 4 or lower Illusion monster from your Deck to your hand. You can only activate 1 "Tricks of the Mind" per turn.
main.name: Tricks of the Mind

main.effect:
When a card or effect is activated on the field, while you control a "Tri-Brigade" monster with 2400 or more ATK: Negate the activation, and if you do, apply 1 of these effects.
● Destroy that card.
● Activate, or Set, 1 "Tri-Brigade" Spell directly from your Deck.
You can banish this card from your GY; Special Summon 1 of your banished "Tri-Brigade" Link Monsters. You can only use 1 "Tri-Brigade, Gather Round!" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tri-Brigade, Gather 'Round!

main.effect: (Quick Effect): You can banish 1 "Tri-Brigade" card from your face-up field or GY, except "Tri-Brigade Xander"; Special Summon this card from your hand, then, immediately after this effect resolves, you can Link Summon 1 "Tri-Brigade" monster using materials you control. If this card is banished: You can target 1 "Tri-Brigade" card in your GY; Set it to your field. You can only use each effect of "Tri-Brigade Xander" once per turn.
main.name: Tri-Brigade Xander

main.effect: If this card is Normal Summoned: You can add 1 "Abartech" monster from your Deck to your hand. If a Trap Card is activated, while this card is in your GY: You can add it to your hand, or, if an "Abartech" Trap Card was activated, you can Special Summon it, instead. You can only use each effect of "Trent, Abartech Researcher" once per turn.
main.name: Trent, Abartech Researcher

main.effect: If this card is Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 Fish Normal Monster from your hand, Deck, or GY. If your opponent activates a Spell Card: You can Special Summon this card from your GY and destroy 1 card your opponent controls. You can only use each effect of "Trench Trooper, Code Jaws" once per turn, also you cannot Special Summon Effect Monsters more than once during the turn you activate either of this card's effects, except "Trench Trooper" monsters.
main.name: Trench Trooper, Code Jaws

main.effect: If this card is Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 "Trench Trooper" monster from your hand or GY. If your opponent activates a monster effect in their hand or GY: You can Special Summon this card from your GY and send the top 2 cards of your Deck to the GY, and if you do, inflict 300 damage to your opponent for each Trap in the GYs. You can only use each effect of "Trench Trooper, Code Jaws" once per turn, also you cannot Special Summon Effect Monsters more than once during the turn you activate either of this card's effects, except "Trench Trooper" monsters.
main.name: Trench Trooper, Code Diver

main.effect: If this card is Summoned: You can excavate cards from the top of your Deck until you excavate a Trap, non-Fish monster, or a 3rd Spell, and if you do, if that card is a Trap, Set it to your field, also shuffle the rest into the Deck. When an attack is declared: You can Special Summon this card from your GY and 1 "Bait Token" (DARK/Fish/Level 1/ATK 0/DEF 0), also, after that, face-up monsters currently on the field are shuffled into the Deck when they leave the field. You can only use each effect of "Trench Trooper, Code Blast" once per turn, also you cannot Special Summon Effect Monsters more than once during the turn you activate either of this card's effects, except "Trench Trooper" monsters.
main.name: Trench Trooper, Code Blast

main.effect: (Quick Effect): You can send the top 2 cards of your Deck to the GY, then target 1 "Ventuoso" monster in your field or GY; Special Summon this card from your hand, and if you do, return that target to the hand. You can only use this effect of "Trayato, Ventuoso" once per turn. While this card is in your GY, all "Ventuoso" monsters you control gain 100 ATK/DEF.
main.name: Trayato, Ventuoso

main.effect: If you have no cards in your face-down Extra Deck: Draw 2 cards. You can only activate 1 "Transdimensional Enlightenment" per turn. You cannot activate Continuous Trap Cards or effects during the Duel you activate this card.
main.name: Transdimensional Enlightenment

main.effect: Send 1 "Carcharrack" monster from your Deck to your GY, or if you control "Kanaloa, the Ultimate Carcharrack", you can send 1 "Carcharrack" card instead. During the End Phase: You can Set this card from your GY to your field, but banish it when it leaves the field. You can only use 1 effect of "Tragic Defeat of the Carcharracks" per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tragic Defeat of the Carcharracks

main.effect: When this card is activated: You can add 1 "Ominous Power" monster from your Deck to your hand. You can only use this effect of "Totem of the Elements" once per turn. Once per turn, if a monster is Summoned: You can activate the following effect; the name of the next Spell Card activated this turn becomes "Ominous Power".
main.name: Totem of the Elements

main.effect: Add 1 Level 4 or lower DARK Fiend monster with an effect that activates by Tributing a DARK monster(s) or an effect that activates when Tributed, OR 1 "Darkest Diabolos" monster from your Deck to your hand, then you can Tribute 1 monster you control, and if you do, Special Summon that added monster. You can only activate 1 "Tormenting Tricks" per turn. If you control a "Torment Token(s)", you can activate this card from your hand.
main.name: Tormenting Tricks

main.effect: Cannot attack the turn it is Summoned. While you control "Toon World" and your opponent controls no Toon monsters, this card can attack your opponent directly. If you control "Toon World" (Quick Effect): You can send 1 "Toon Harpie Lady" from your Deck to the GY; Special Summon this card from your hand, then destroy 1 Spell/Trap on the field. If this card is sent from the field to the GY: You can add 1 Toon monster from your GY to your hand, except "Toon Harpie Lady Sisters". If a "Toon World(s)" you control would be destroyed by card effect, you can send this card you control to the GY instead.
main.name: Toon Harpie Lady Sisters

main.effect: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must first be Special Summoned (from your hand) by banishing 3 Toon monsters from your hand, field, and/or GY. While you control "Toon World" and your opponent controls no Toon monsters, this card can attack directly. Once per turn (Quick Effect): You can discard 1 Toon monster, then target 1 monster your opponent controls; banish it until the End Phase. During your opponent's turn, if you control "Toon World" (Quick Effect): You can banish this card you control; Special Summon 3 Toon monsters with different names that are banished and/or in your GY, except "Toon Dragon Buster", also you cannot Special Summon monsters until the end of your next turn, except Toon monsters. You can only use this effect of "Toon Dragon Buster" once per turn.
main.name: Toon Dragon Buster

main.effect: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must first be Special Summoned (from your hand) by banishing 2 Toon monsters from your GY. While you control "Toon World" and your opponent controls no Toon monsters, this card can attack your opponent directly. Once per turn, during the Main Phase (Quick Effect): You can Tribute 1 Toon monster you control or in your hand, and if you do, change all face-up monsters your opponent controls to face-down Defense Position. This card can attack all monsters your opponent controls, once each. At the start of the Damage Step, if this card attacks a Defense Position monster: You can inflict 1000 damage to your opponent, and if you do, send that Defense Position monster to the GY.
main.name: Toon Conductor Tyranno

main.effect: If you control a "Tokyo Terror" monster: Target 1 card on the field; destroy it. You can banish this card from your GY; Set 1 "Tokyo Terror" Spell/Trap from your Deck, except "Tokyo Terror - Who Will Know". You can only use 1 "Tokyo Terror - Who Will Know" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Who Will Know

main.effect: "Tokyo Terror" monsters you control cannot be destroyed by your opponent's card effects. You can send this card you control to the GY; Special Summon 1 "Tokyo Terror" monster from your hand. You can banish this card from your GY, then target 1 "Tokyo Terror" monster that is banished or in your GY; add it to your hand. You can only use 1 "Tokyo Terror - Unstoppable Force" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Unstoppable Force

main.effect:
If you control a "Tokyo Terror" monster: Shuffle any number of your banished "Tokyo Terror" Spells/Traps with different names into the Deck, and if you do, if you shuffled at least 4 to 6 cards into the Deck by this effect, apply 1 of the following effects.
● Destroy all monsters your opponent controls.
● Destroy all Spell/Traps your opponent controls.
You can only activate 1 "Tokyo Terror - Unfinished Business" per turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Unfinished Business

main.effect: Target 1 "Tokyo Terror" card in your GY; if it is a Spell/Trap, Set it to your field, or, if it is a monster, Special Summon it, but it cannot attack this turn. You can banish this card from your GY; Set 1 "Tokyo Terror - City Decimation" from your Deck. You can only use 1 "Tokyo Terror - Threat at Hand" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Threat at Hand

main.effect: If this card is Special Summoned: You can negate the effects of 1 face-up card your opponent controls until the end of this turn. During the Standby Phase, if this card was not Summoned this turn (Quick Effect): You can Tribute this card; Special Summon 1 "Tokyo Terror - Shin Gojira" from your hand or Deck. You can only use each effect of "Tokyo Terror - Shinagawa Kun" once per turn. You cannot Summon/Set monsters the Duel this card is Summoned, except "Tokyo Terror" monsters.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Shinagawa Kun

main.effect: If this card is Special Summoned: You can negate the effects of all face-up cards your opponent currently controls, and if you do, this card cannot attack directly for the rest of this turn. When a card or effect is activated that targets a "Tokyo Terror" card(s) you control (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that card. If this card battles an opponent's monster (Quick Effect): You can destroy all cards in 1 column on the field. If this card is sent to the GY: You can target 1 Level 6 or lower "Tokyo Terror" monster in your GY; Special Summon it. You can only use each effect of "Tokyo Terror - Shin Gojira" once per turn. You cannot Summon/Set monsters the Duel this card is Summoned, except "Tokyo Terror" monsters.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Shin Gojira

main.effect: If you control a "Tokyo Terror" monster: Target 1 face-up card your opponent controls; negate the effects of all cards with the same name as that targeted card's name in its owner's possession this turn. You can banish this card from your GY; Set 1 "Tokyo Terror" Continuous Trap directly from your Deck. It can be activated this turn. You can only use 1 "Tokyo Terror - Looming Presence" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Looming Presence

main.effect: If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can reveal 1 "Tokyo Terror" card in your hand; take 1 "Tokyo Terror" card from your Deck with a different original name, except "Tokyo Terror - Kamata Kun", and either add it to your hand, or send it to the GY. During the Standby Phase (Quick Effect): You can Tribute this card; Special Summon 1 "Tokyo Terror - Shinigawa Kun" from your hand or Deck. You can only use each effect of "Tokyo Terror - Kamata Kun" once per turn. You cannot Summon/Set monsters the Duel this card is Summoned, except "Tokyo Terror" monsters.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Kamata Kun

main.effect:
Monsters your opponent controls lose 200 ATK/DEF for each of your banished "Tokyo Terror" cards. You can activate 1 "Tokyo Terror" Spell/Trap the turn it was Set. During your Main Phase, or if your opponent activates a card or effect: You can target 1 of your “Tokyo Terror” cards that is banished or in your GY; apply 1 of these effects.
● If it is a Spell/Trap: Either add it to your hand OR shuffle it into the Deck and Set 1 “Tokyo Terror” Spell/Trap with a different name from your Deck.
● If it is a monster: Special Summon it.
You can only use each effect of "Tokyo Terror - Evolutionary Threshold" once per turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Evolutionary Threshold

main.effect: Activate this card by targeting 1 "Tokyo Terror" monster you control; it gains 1000 ATK, also it can make a second attack on monsters your opponent controls during each Battle Phase. You can banish this card from your GY; Set 1 "Tokyo Terror - Atomic Blast!" from your Deck. You can only use 1 "Tokyo Terror - City Decimation" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - City Decimation

main.effect:
"Tokyo Terror" monsters you control gain 200 ATK/DEF for each of your banished "Tokyo Terror" cards. You can only use each effect of "Tokyo Terror - City Ablaze" once per turn.
● You can discard 1 card; add 1 "Tokyo Terror" monster from your Deck or GY to your hand.
● You can activate 1 "Tokyo Terror" Spell/Trap the turn it was Set.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - City Ablaze

main.effect: When a card or effect is activated, while you control a "Tokyo Terror" monster: Negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it, then inflict 1000 damage to your opponent. You can banish this card from your GY; draw 1 card, then discard 1 card. You can only use 1 "Tokyo Terror - Atomic Blast!" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Atomic Blast!

main.effect: Target 1 card in your opponent's GY; banish it, or, if you control a face-up "Tokyo Terror" monster, you can banish that card face-down instead. You can banish this card from your GY; Set 1 "Tokyo Terror - Threat at Hand" from your Deck. You can only use 1 "Tokyo Terror - Adaptation" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - Adaptation

main.effect: Special Summon 1 Level 6 or lower "Tokyo Terror" monster from your Deck or GY. You can banish this card from your GY; Set 1 "Tokyo Terror - Adaptation" from your Deck. You can only use 1 "Tokyo Terror - A Beast's Awakening" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
main.name: Tokyo Terror - A Beast's Awakening

extra.effect:
1 "Twirlstia" Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner monsters
While "Twirlstia Wings of Hope" is face-up in your Field Zone, your opponent cannot target monsters you control with card effects or attacks, except this card. You can only use each of the following effects of "Twirlstia Grebenoir" once per turn. If this card is Synchro Summoned, or if a "Twirlstia" monster is Special Summoned from the Extra Deck: You can add 1 "Twirlstia" monster from your Deck to your hand. If your opponent Special Summons a monster(s): You can change as many of those monsters as possible to face-down Defense Position.

extra.effect:
2 Effect Monsters with different Types, including 1 LIGHT and 1 DARK monster

You can Tribute this card or discard 1 card, then target 1 of your banished LIGHT or DARK monsters; add it to your hand, and if you do, send 1 LIGHT or DARK monster that cannot be Normal Summoned/Set from your Deck to your GY, with a Level from 4 to 8, and with a different Attribute than that added monster. You can only use this effect of "Twin Wings, Alestiel" once per turn.

2+ "Tri-Brigade" monsters
(Quick Effect): You can banish 1 Beast, Beast-Warrior, or Winged Beast monster from your Deck, and if you do, this turn, this card gains ATK equal to that banished monster's Level x 100, also "Tri-Brigade" cards you currently control cannot be targeted by your opponent's card effects. If this card is sent to the GY: You can place up to 3 of your banished monsters on the top or bottom of your Deck in any order. You can only use each effect of "Tri-Brigade Bardawulf the Guiding Glasser" once per turn.

2 monsters including a "Trench Trooper" monster
Unaffected by Trap effects. (Quick Effect): You can send 1 card you control to the GY; this card gains 500 ATK.

"Spyro the Dragon" you control gain 500 ATK and are unaffected by the effects of your opponent's monsters that target them. If this card is sent to the GY: You can target 1 monster your opponent controls that started the Duel in the Main Deck; send it to the GY.

extra.effect:
2 "Tokyo Terror" monsters, including 1 Level 10 monster
Must be Special Summoned (from your Extra Deck) by Tributing the above cards you control, or by banishing the above materials from your GY. If this card is Special Summoned: Special Summon as many "Final Form Tokens" (Fiend/Level 12/FIRE/ATK 1000/DEF 0), but they cannot be used as Link Material, nor can they be Tributed. 1 "Thunder Dragon" monster + 1 Thunder monster

extra.effect:
2+ monsters
This card and monsters this card points to cannot be destroyed by card effects during the Battle Phase. If a monster this card points to destroys an opponent's monster by battle: You can target 1 Spell/Trap your opponent controls; send it to the GY, and if you do, that monster can declare a second attack in a row. The targeted Spell/Trap cannot be activated or activate its effects in response to this effect's activation. You can only use this effect of "Theseus, the Prime Champion" once per turn.

2+ Level 6 monsters

2 "Darklord" monsters including a Level 9 or higher monster

main.effect: While you control "Sacred Crane" or "Sacred Gryph", your opponent must target this card for attacks. (Quick Effect): You can reveal this card in your hand, and note the difference between the number of cards in you and your opponent's hands; if that difference is 0, Special Summon this card. Otherwise, discard this card, then you can draw cards up to that difference, and if you do, place the same number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your Deck in any order. Then, if you have a face-up "Sacred Crane" or "Sacred Gryph" in your possession, you can draw 1 card. You can only use this effect of "Sacred Crane Rearer" once per turn.

main.effect:
You can reveal this card in your hand; send 1 Spell/Trap with a coin tossing effect from your Deck to the GY, then toss a coin.
● Heads: Special Summon this card.
● Tails: Place this card in your Pendulum Zone.
If this card is Special Summoned: You can add 1 card with a coin tossing effect from your GY to your hand. You can only use each Monster Effect of "Rusted Pendulum Machine" once per turn.

You cannot Pendulum Summon monsters, except "Launcher Spider", "Zoa", and DARK Machine monsters. When you would Special Summon a monster(s), Toss a coin, and if the result is Tails, negate the Summon, and if you do, destroy it, also for the rest of this turn you cannot Special Summon monsters with that same name. You can only use the following Pendulum Effect "Rusted Pendulum Machine" of once per turn. During your Main Phase: You can toss a coin and add the appropriate card from your Deck to your hand.
● Heads: 1 DARK Machine monster that has a coin tossing effect, except "Rusted Pendulum Machine".
● Tails: 1 "Heavy Metal Raiders".

main.effect: During the Standby Phase, if you control no monsters (Quick Effect): You can Special Summon this card from your hand. When your opponent activates a card or effect (Quick Effect): You can target 1 other card you control; for the rest of this turn, that card and this face-up card are unaffected by the effects of an opponent's cards of the same type (Monster, Spell, or Trap) as that card. If this card is sent to the GY by your opponent's card: You can target up to 2 monsters in your GY with the same Type and Attribute, but a different Level from each other; return this card to the Extra Deck, and if you do, return those cards to the hand. You can only use each effect of "Security Chimera" once per turn.

extra.effect:
1 WATER Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner WATER monsters
Once per Chain (Quick Effect): You can banish this card until the next Standby Phase. When this banished card enters a Monster Zone: Draw 1 card, also it gains 1100 ATK/DEF.

extra.effect:
1 LIGHT Warrior monster + 1 Spellcaster monster
Must first be Fusion Summoned, or Special Summoned the turn a LIGHT "Noble Knight" monster is destroyed by battle or card effect by banishing the above materials from your hand, field, or GY. If a card on the field is destroyed: You can target 1 face-up monster on the field or in either GY; negate its effects if it is on the field, otherwise, Special Summon it. During the Standby Phase, if this card is in your GY: You can banish 1 LIGHT monster from your GY; Special Summon this card, and if you do, it gains 500 ATK. You can only use each effect of "Saintly Noble Knight Joan" once per turn.
extra.name: Saintly Noble Knight Joan

side.effect:
3 Effect Monsters with different Attributes
Once per Chain (Quick Effect): You can target 1 Effect Monster this card points to; equip it to this card as an Equip Spell that gives it 300 ATK, also for the rest of this turn, you cannot target monsters with the same Attribute as that target to activate this effect of "Yuuma Toutetsu, All-Consuming Taotie". If this card would be destroyed by battle or card effect, you can destroy 1 card equipped to this card, instead.
side.name: Yuuma Toutetsu, All-Consuming Taotie

side.effect:
2+ Level 8 monsters
Gains 300 ATK/DEF for each card attached to it as material. If this card leaves the field, banish all cards that were attached to it as material, face-down. Up to thrice per turn, if another card(s) is placed in this card’s column: You can banish all cards attached to this card as material, face-down, then attach cards from the top of the turn player’s Deck to this card as material, up to the number of cards in this card’s column, then you can move this card to another of your Main Monster Zones, or switch the location of this card in your Main Monster Zone with another monster in your Main Monster Zone.

side.effect:
2+ Level 3 Plant monsters, including an "Emeraheart" monster
Once per turn, you can also Xyz Summon "Yinyin, Emeraheart Wanderer" by banishing 3 non-Xyz "Emeraheart" monsters (1 from your field and 2 from your GY). If this card is Special Summoned: You can attach 1 of your banished "Emeraheart" cards to this card as material. When your opponent activates a monster effect (Quick Effect): You can detach 1 material from this card; negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that monster. You can only use this effect of "Yinyin, Emeraheart Wanderer" per turn.
side.name: Yinyin, Emeraheart Wanderer

side.effect:
1 "Yang Zing" Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner monsters, including a Synchro Monster
As Chain Link 2, when a card or effect is activated (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it, then destroy 1 other Wyrm monster you control. You can use this effect a number of times per turn up to the number of different original Attributes of the "Yang Zing" monsters used for the Synchro Summon of this card. Once per turn, if a Wyrm monster(s) you control is destroyed: You can activate 1 of these effects.
● Destroy 1 card on the field.
● Draw 1 card.
● Special Summon 1 Wyrm Tuner from your GY.

side.effect:
1 Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner monsters
If this card is Synchro Summoned: You can activate this effect; both players draw 1 card and reveal it, then, if both cards are the same type (Monster, Spell, or Trap), both players draw 1 more card. Once per turn (Quick Effect): You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; during the End Phase of the next turn, destroy it, but you cannot use this effect of "Wishmaker Starchild" again next turn.

side.effect:
2 "Swordsmaster" monsters
If this card attacks a Defense Position monster, inflict piercing battle damage. Gains 100 ATK for each "Swordsmaster" monster you control. If a "Swordsmaster" monster activates its effect: You can Special Summon 1 "Swordsmaster" monster from your GY in face-up Defense Position to your zone this card points to. You can only use this effect of "Winged Swordsmaster Iona" once per turn.

side.effect: Fusion Summon 1 Yokai Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck, using Monster Cards from your hand and/or field as material, but it cannot attack directly this turn. Normal Monsters, Normal Monster Cards, and Normal Pendulum Monsters in your Pendulum Zones in your possession, can be treated as Yokai monsters for this Fusion Summon.

At the end of this turn, if you drew 2 or more cards by this effect, shuffle cards from your hand into the Deck until you only have 1 card in your hand. You can only activate 1 "One Precious Ring" per turn.

side.effect: If you control a Level 6 monster, you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). If this card is used as Synchro Material: Equip it to that monster. Once per turn, you can either: Target 1 Synchro Monster you control; equip this card to that target, OR: Unequip this card and Special Summon it. A monster equipped with this card gains 600 ATK/DEF, also if it would be destroyed by battle or card effect, destroy this card instead. You can only Special Summon "On-It! Bringer" once per turn.

You can target 1 Link Monster in your GY; banish it, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "Okiba" Link Monster from your Extra Deck with the same Link Rating as that banished card.

Gourmet Break”, then if you control a “Princess Connect!” Fusion Monster, it can be activated this turn. main.effect: (Quick Effect): You can discard this card; if it is the Draw Phase of the first turn of this Duel, draw 1 card, also, after that, until the end of the next turn, the activated effects of the first monster(s) you Normal Summon after this effect resolves cannot be negated. You can use 1 "Predaplant Stapeliaworm" effect per turn, and only once per turn.

● “Potential” monsters with a number in their name.
● Monsters with the number “92” in their name.

While this card is a Normal Monster on the field, you can Normal Summon it to have it become an Effect Monster with these effects.

main.effect: Draw 1 card for every 1250 ATK the highest ATK on the field has, then reveal them. If the total ATK of the drawn card(s) is less than the highest ATK on the field (Spells/Traps are treated as having an ATK of 0), lose LP equal to the highest ATK on the field. After resolving this card, you cannot activate Spells/Traps until the next time battle damage is inflicted, also you cannot draw cards by card effects for the rest of the turn.

main.effect:
Apply these effects.
● During your next Draw Phase, draw 2 additional cards.
● Only 1 monster you control can attack during each Battle Phase this turn.
● You can only Special Summon up to 2 monsters during each Main Phase this turn.

main.effect:
Choose 1 of the listed categories, and follow its text.
● Declare 1 monster Type and Attribute.
● Declare 1 Spell Card type. (Normal Spell, Quick-Play, Continuous, Equip, Field).
● Declare 1 Trap Card type. (Normal Trap, Continuous, Counter).
Then look at the top card of your Deck. If that card matches the declared option, draw 2 cards. Otherwise, banish the top 10 cards of your Deck, face-down (all, if less than 10). You can only activate 1 "Pot of Pride" per turn.

main.effect:
Choose 1 of the listed categories. If your opponent controls more cards of the chosen category than you do (min. 3), add the top 2 cards of your Deck to your hand.
● Special Summoned monsters with 2500 or more ATK.
● Face-up cards whose original type is Spell/Trap.
After this effect resolves, until the End Phase of your next turn, or until you control 3 or more cards of the chosen category, you cannot add cards to your hand by card effects, except by Normal Spells/Traps, and monsters you control cannot attack directly this turn. You can only activate 1 "Pot of Luxuria" per turn.

main.effect:
Target 3 or 6 of these cards in your GY, except "Pot of Gluttony"; shuffle them into the Deck, then draw 1 card for every 3 cards shuffled into the Deck this way.
● Mentions taking damage.
● Mentions gaining LP.
● Mentions adding a card(s) to your hand.

main.effect: Banish 3 to 5 cards from your hand and/or Extra Deck, face-down (min. 1 from each location); for the rest of the turn after this effect resolves, any damage your opponent takes is halved, also excavate the same number of cards from the top of your Deck, and if you do, add 1 excavated card to your hand, and banish the rest, face-down. Then add the top card of your Deck to your hand. For the rest of the turn after this card resolves, you cannot add cards from your Deck to your hand by Spell/Trap effects.

main.effect: Excavate cards from the top of your Deck, equal to the number of cards added from your opponent's Main Deck to their hand or GY in the previous turn (max. 6). Add up to 2 excavated cards with different names to your hand, then place 1 card from your hand, and the remaining cards, on the bottom of your Deck in any order. For the rest of the turn after this card resolves, each time you add a card(s) from your Deck to your hand, you must banish 1 card from your hand, face-down. Neither player can activate monster effects in response to this card's activation.

main.effect: Draw 2N cards, also, after that, if you did not draw by this effect, take 1000 damage. (N = the number of times you have resolved "Pot of Destitution" previously this Duel.)

main.effect: Declare 1 card name; your opponent excavates the top 5 cards of their Deck, then shuffles them back into the Deck. If there were any cards with the declared name amongst the excavated cards, draw cards equal to the number of excavated cards with the declared name. Otherwise, your opponent can draw 1 card.

● If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can set 1 "Veridian” Spell to your Spell & Trap Zone, then you can destroy this card.
● If this card is destroyed: You can place this card in the Pendulum Zone, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "Illusion Token" (Yokai/EARTH/Level 2/ATK 1300/DEF 1000) to your opponent's field.

main.pendulum_effect: If an attack is declared involving a monster with 2600 ATK & 1000 DEF you control: You can target 1 "Veridian" Spell/Trap in your GY; take damage equal to half of your battling monster’s original ATK, then add the targeted card to your hand. You can only use this effect of "Diego, the Mechanical Genius" once per turn.

main.effect:
Once per turn: You can roll a six-sided die, then apply 1 of these effects.
● 1: Set 1 Spell/Trap from your opponent's GY to your field.
● 2: Place 1 face-up Spell/Trap from your opponent's field in your Spell & Trap Zone.
● 3: Make your opponent send 1 Spell/Trap from their Deck to the GY. This turn, that card cannot activate its effects.
● 4: Destroy 1 Set Spell/Trap on the field, then you can Set it to your field.
● 5: Destroy 1 Spell/Trap on each field.
● 6: Look at your opponent's hand, then you can add 1 Spell/Trap from it to your hand, and if you do, your opponent draws 1 card.

main.effect: As the dragon planet spun through space, a comet passed by, close enough to shine like a fourth moon in Pyrrhia’s sky. Close enough to change the tides and shake the continents. As earthquakes rumbled through the ground, long-buried rocks shifted that had been in place for thousands of years. Deep underground, in the darkness, copper wires snapped. And a dragon awoke…

If this card is Syncho Summoned: You can banish 1 Spell/Trap from your hand; draw 1 card. When your opponent activates a monster effect (Quick Effect): You can shuffle 1 banished Spell/Trap into your Deck, then target 1 card your opponent controls; shuffle it into the Deck. You can only use 1 "Trickian Wonder Alexis" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
side.name: Trickian Wonder Alexis

side.effect:
4+ Beast, Beast-Warrior, and/or Winged Beast monsters
Cannot be Special Summoned from the Extra Deck unless you have 5 or more face-up "Tri-Brigade" cards with different names in your possession. Your opponent cannot negate Special Summons of a monster(s), or effects that Special Summon a monster(s), or their activations. You can only use each of these effects of "Tri-Brigade Deconstructed Weapon Excubitor III" once per turn.
● If this card is Special Summoned, or a monster is Summoned/Set to a zone a Link Monster points to: You can banish 1 card from your opponent’s field or GY.
● If this card is sent to the GY: You can return any number of your banished Beast, Beast-Warrior, and/or Winged Beast monsters to your GY; Special Summon 1 Beast, Beast-Warrior, or Winged Beast Link Monster from your Extra Deck, with Link Rating equal to the number returned, also you can only use Beast, Beast-Warrior, and Winged Beast monsters as Link Material for the rest of this turn.
side.name: Tri-Brigade Deconstructed Weapon Excubitor III

side.effect:
1 non-Link “Trapod” monster
"Trapod" monsters you control gain 200 ATK/DEF for each “Trapod” card in your GY. During the Main Phase, you can (Quick Effect): Immediately after this effect resolves, Link Summon 1 “Trapod” Link Monster from your Extra Deck, using materials you control. You can only use this effect of “Transmitting Trapod” once per turn.
side.name: Transmitting Trapod

side.effect:
2+ Effect Monsters
Monsters you control inflict piercing battle damage. If a monster(s) is Special Summoned to a zone(s) this card points to: Banish as many of those monster(s) as possible, then all monsters your opponent currently controls lose ATK/DEF equal to the number of monsters banished by this effect x 1000, then inflict damage to your opponent equal to the number of monsters banished by this effect x 400.
side.name: Topologic Integratarus

main.effect:
If this card is Special Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 "Okiba" Link-1 monster from your Extra Deck, and if you do, equip this card to it. If this card is Normal Summoned: You can add 1 "Okiba" Spell/Trap from your Deck to your hand. An "Okiba" Link Monster equipped with this card gains this effect.
● Once per turn (Quick Effect): You can return 1 "Okiba Neon Berserker" from your Spell & Trap Zone to the hand, then target 1 monster your opponent controls; destroy it.
You can only use each effect of "Okiba Neon Berseker" once per turn.

main.effect:
If you control no monsters: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. If this card is Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 "Okiba" Link-2 monster from your Extra Deck, and if you do, equip this card to it. You cannot Special Summon monsters, except Machine and Beast-Warrior monsters the turn you activate this effect. An "Okiba" Link Monster equipped with this card gains this effect.
● Once per turn: You can send 1 "Okiba Greasefang, The Leader" from your Spell & Trap Zone to the GY, and if you do, add 1 "Okiba" monster from your Deck to your hand, except "Okiba Greasefang, The Leader".
You can only use each effect of "Okiba Greasefang, The Leader" once per turn.

If you control both a face-up Machine monster and Beast-Warrior monster: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. If your opponent activates a card or effect while you control at least 1 card owned by your opponent: You can Tribute this card; draw 1 card. If this card is sent from the Monster Zone to GY: You can Special Summon 1 Link-2 or lower "Okiba" monster from your Extra Deck, and if you do, equip 1 "Okiba" monster from your Deck to it, except "Okiba Ambusher".

main.effect: (Quick Effect): You can Tribute 1 other "Ojama" monster on the field; Special Summon 1 "Ojama King" from your Extra Deck to your Extra Monster Zone. (This is treated as a Fusion Summon.) While you control "Ojama King", your opponent cannot target monsters you control with card effects, except "Ojama King", also their monsters cannot target monsters for attacks, except "Ojama King".

main.effect:
(This card is always treated as an "Ogrise" card.)

If an "Ogrise" Spell/Trap you control is destroyed while this card is in your GY: You can Set this card from your GY. You can only use each effect of "Ogrising Counterblow" once per turn.

You can only use each effect of "Ogrise to the Challenge" once per turn.

Equip only to an "Ogrise" monster. When activating this card, you can apply the following effect instead of equipping it to a monster you control.

main.effect:

● At the end of this turn, each player with more than 3 cards in their hand discards a number of cards equal to the difference.
● At the end of this turn, each player with less than 3 cards in their hand draws cards equal to the difference.
You can only use this effect of "Night Sprit" once per turn.

main.effect: Do you remember that time when we were still together? When we danced in the night, and we thought we were immortals? I guess that wasn't the case... but as long as we remember each other we will be fine! After all how could we forget the beautiful times we lived together? If you remember me I will truly be immortal, and I will be watching you. Forever.
